definitions.definition: The act or process of capitalising .

subdefinitions.definition: Choice of case (when writing a word); the act or process of writing a word in a particular case , such as ALL CAPS , Title Case , CamelCase , Sentence case , or all lowercase . ( in particular ) The act or process of writing (something: either an entire word or text, or just the initial letter(s) thereof) in capital letters.
examples: English and French have different rules for the capitalisation of the names of the days of the week.
The capitalisation of all nouns is a distinctive feature of German.

subdefinitions.definition: The act or process of seizing (an opportunity) and profiting or obtaining an advantage (from it).
The state of having a particular case , such as ALL CAPS or all lowercase.
examples: His capitalisation was erratic: sometimes he wrote "British", sometimes "british", sometimes "briTish"...

definitions.definition: The total value of all outstanding shares for a publicly traded company

main_definition: The act or process of capitalising .
secondary_definitions: The total value of all outstanding shares for a publicly traded company
